hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaibah: Zaid ibn al-Hubab narrated to us from Ibn Lahiah who narrated to us from Yazid ibn Amr al-Ma'afiri, who said: I heard Abu Thaur saying that Abd al-Rahman ibn Udais al-Balawi came to us (and he was one of those who gave the oath of allegiance under the tree), and he praised Allah and spoke well of Him, then he mentioned Uthman. hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Wahhab ibn Najdah al-Hawti: Ismail ibn Ayyash narrated to us from Bahir ibn Sa'd, from Khalid ibn Ma'dan, from Kathir ibn Murrah, from Numayy ibn Hammar may Allah be pleased with him, that a man came to the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and asked: Which of the martyrs are the best? He ﷺ said: Those who meet the people in battle in a line and do not turn their faces until they are killed. Those are those who recline in the highest rooms of Paradise. Your Lord smiles at them, and when your Lord smiles at a slave in a place, there is no reckoning upon him.
